field_label:
Please wash your hands before starting.

Dry them with a clean towel.

Sit down at a clean table and lay the test kit out.

The kit contains: 2 microtubes, 2 lancets, 1 alcohol wipe, 1 sterile gauze, 2 plasters and 1 postal kit.

Disinfect your middle or ring finger with the alcohol wipe.

Let it dry in the air.

Remove the yellow caps from both microtubes.

Place the microtubes upright in the grooves of the plastic case.

Twist and pull the blue cap off the lancet.

Donâ€™t touch the newly exposed white part as this will activate the lancet.

Press your fingertip with your thumb so it turns pink.

With your thumb in place, press the lancet firmly into the side of your finger until you hear a click.

Massage your finger towards the tip, until a blood droplet forms. Wipe this away with the gauze.

Massage until another droplet forms.

Fill the 1st microtube to the 600 mark, then fill the 2nd microtube to the 600 mark.

Use the 2nd lancet on a different finger if required.

Apply the plaster.

Push the yellow caps back onto the microtubes.

Gently turn each microtube upside down 5 times.

Apply the sticky labels to the microtubes.

Make sure all the writing is visible.

Put both microtubes in the plastic case. Close the case so it snaps shut.

Write the date and time on the return form.

Put the return form and plastic case containing your samples into the grey postal bag. Seal the bag shut.

Stick the Royal Mail label onto the grey postal bag.

Post it on the same day the sample was taken. In summer, avoid postboxes exposed to the sun.
